messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: take the test...
messages.msgSnippet: Hojo Soun was the only daimyo who chose to resist Toyotomi Hideyoshi s push to control the entire country... check this;  www.samurai-archives.com -t

Hojo Soun
was the only daimyo who chose to resist Toyotomi Hideyoshi's push to
control the entire country...

check this; www.samurai-archives.com

-t

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] take the test...

messages.messageBody:

>
> Jim
>
Always new there was a ruthless bastard under that pleasant exterior...
-t

messages.subject: Ichimonji Schools
messages.msgSnippet: Gang let me bring this to your attention as well: http://www.aoi-art.ab.psiweb.com/sword/consigned/cksword08.html Does anyone know of any good papers or books
messages.messageBody:
Gang let me bring this to your attention as well:

http://www.aoi-art.ab.psiweb.com/sword/consigned/cksword08.html

Does anyone know of any good papers or books dealing specifically with
the Ichimonji schools of the Kamakura period in English ? This seems
like an interesting area for me to further my studies !

- Matt


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: juyo tachi koshirae
messages.msgSnippet: Gang check this out:  http://www.aoi-art.ab.psiweb.com/sale/sale01.html new at Aoi Arts a $46k Itomaki-tachi
messages.messageBody:
Gang check this out:
<http://www.aoi-art.ab.psiweb.com/sale/sale01.html>
http://www.aoi-art.ab.psiweb.com/sale/sale01.html

new at Aoi Arts a $46k Itomaki-tachi Koshirae

In the text it says that the nanako is 'closer grained than usual'.

Can someone please elaborate on this ? \

Do closer grains = better quality etc ?

- Matt


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

Rich
